body: IMO we should solve this one time for all Kubernetes gateways and not special class anything for waypoints

@keithmattix k8s gateways already support configurable resources ([xref](https://github.com/istio/istio/blob/master/manifests/charts/gateway/templates/deployment.yaml#L86-L87)). I'm proposing that we take the same approach for waypoints.

I believe that's the regular Istio gateway; the k8s gateway one isn't a helm template: https://github.com/istio/istio/blob/master/manifests/charts/istio-control/istio-discovery/files/kube-gateway.yaml

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

Previously, waypoint CPU and memory resources were hardcoded. This PR updates the waypoint deployment to allow these resources to be configured by `.Values.global.waypoint.resources`.

Fixes #51496

body:
> I would set them to `.Values.global.proxy.resources`

Correct me if I'm wrong, it's not recommend to use Sidecar and Ambient together, but it's our goal.
In a mixed cluster(with both Sidecar and Waypoint), the default resource should be different, is it better to use a seperate resources from the begining (e.g. `Values.global.waypoint.resources`)?
I would suggest we introduce a annotation on gateway, waypoint can be deployed per namespace/service/pod, which is quite different.

> I would suggest we introduce a annotation on gateway, waypoint can be deployed per namespace/service/pod, which is quite different.

we can support both like Sidecar/Gateway.

> What do you mean @zirain

support both helm(.values.global.waypoint/proxy.resources) and annotaions(in `Gateway.spec.infrastructure`)
I am not sure waypoint can be deployed by helm now

sharing one resource var path makes sense to me for now. if we encounter a need for anything more granular, that's where

> With https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/gateway-api/pull/2924, gateway parametersRef can manage waypoint resources. However, this requires considerable API changes to implement.

comes in.

I get we may need to offer arbitrary control over resources but I don't think that's the ideal UX for most users.

What % of users need arbitrary control vs something like a t-shirt size option ?

This is a global default value, make sense to me. For fine-grained control ,we can infer  that from gateway or gatewayclass. 

One confusion maybe if we do support both `.Values.global.proxy.resources` and gatewayclass, which one takes priority
